Title: Authentication Is Required for All Sensitive Pages
DirectLink: Authentication Is Required for All Sensitive Pages

Data:
Applies to

  • PHP

What to Check For

Verify that authentication and authorization are required for all sensitive pages.

Why

All pages that have private information should require authentication and authorization to prevent unauthorized information disclosure. Use role-based authorization policies because they are relatively simple to manage correctly.

How to Check

To verify that authentication and authorization are required for all sensitive pages:

  1. Identify all sensitive pages. Make a list of all pages that handle sensitive or private information.

  2. Verify that all sensitive pages require authentication. Visit each sensitive page with a web browser to make sure it requires authentication.

How to Fix

To require authentication for all private resources:

  1. Identify all sensitive pages. Make a list of all pages that handle sensitive or private information.

  2. Define roles. Define access roles for your application. These roles should include administrative users and various types of users specific to your application.

  3. Implement authentication. Implement and document authentication APIs to satisfy all application requirements.

  4. Require authentication for all sensitive pages. Add code to all sensitive pages that checks if the user is authenticated and authorized to view them.

Secure Authentication Guidelines

  • Centralize Authentication Controls
  • Require Authentication for All Sensitive Pages
  • Use Server-side Authentication
  • Force Reauthentication for Sensitive Operations
  • Log Authentication Events
  • Mask All Password Fields
  • Lock Accounts After Multiple Failed Authentication Attempts
  • Enforce Strong Password Requirements
  • Force Password Renewal
  • Protect the Account Management Functions
  • Implement Authentication Controls to Fail Securely
